fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Trade, Enlargement, Business and Industry, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, External Relations, Banking and financial services

section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
goals__remit:
CIArb is a leading professional membership body for alternative dispute resolution (ADR) in all its forms.  It represents 15,000 ADR professionals globally and is mandated by its Royal Charter to promote its Golden Thread: 
 
•    To deliver education, training and qualifications 
•    To develop the learned society 
•    Facilitate ADR 
 
As a not-for-profit, UK registered charity and Royal Chartered Institute; CIArb works for the public benefit through an international network of 39 branches. Its 15,000 professionally qualified members are active in  over 140 countries. 
 
CIArb's proactive policy and public affairs programme supports the promotion, facilitation, and development of all forms of private dispute resolution through the dissemination of information and providing a platform for ADR practitioners to share their expertise.
